latex: Suppose that in a certain society, each pair of persons can be classified as either \textit{amicable }or \textit{hostile}. We shall say that each member of an amicable pair is a \textit{friend} of the other, and each member of a hostile pair is a  \textit{foe} of the other.  Suppose that the society has $\, n \,$ persons and $\, q \,$ amicable pairs, and that for every set of three persons, at least one pair is hostile.  Prove that there is at least one member of the society whose foes include $\, q(1 - 4q/n^2) \,$ or fewer amicable pairs.
